page.title: 0120 YEARS AGO IN KINGSBURY
page.content: 20 years ago, Kingsbury was a quiet village situated on a hill overlooking the River Tame,surrounded by farmland, and dominated by its Parish Church,St. Peter's and St.Paul's.Today it is a large,busy village with new housing estates growing around it.Many aspects of the old village have vanished,with the new taking over. A very large Oil Terminus has been constructed on the outskirts;west of the village a Water Park Development is expanding.The A51 Tamworth Road runs through the village and part of the new M42 Motorway runs within one mile of Kingsbury,cutting through the Water Park.Many working inhabitants commute to Birmingham, Coventry or Tamworth.The village is very busy during the morning and evening rush hours,but most other times it takes on the atmosphere of a quiet,rural village.
